title: Ceibwr Bay Walk Route

images.title: Zorba the Geek / Ceibwr Bay in autumn
images.caption: Ceibwr Bay in autumn

images.title: Philip Halling / Stile on Pembrokeshire Coast Path
images.caption: Stile near Pen-castell, above Ceibwr Bay. The Pembrokeshire coast can be seen in the background down to Strumble Head near Fishguard.

images.title: View over the Nant Ceibwr valley by Dave Spicer, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View over the Nant Ceibwr valley

images.title: Mick Heraty / Looking upstream from Ceiwbr Bay
images.caption: Looking upstream from Ceiwbr Bay. Heading north from the bay the coastal path crosses the stream by this bridge made of stone slabs and continues up the hillside to the left.

images.title: Lis Burke / Moylgrove
images.caption: Moylgrove. This pretty village is in a steep valley just 1.5 km inland from Ceibwr Bay.

images.title: Pembroke Coastal Footpath above Ceibwr Bay by Row17, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pembroke Coastal Footpath above the bay. A nice view of the surrounding countryside in summer.

images.title: Rock formations at Ceibwr Bay by Dave Spicer, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: An example of the Rock formations you can see at this geologically fascinating site.

description: This walk explores the beautiful Ceibwr Bay on the Pembrokeshire Coast near Cardigan. This beautiful area includes some wonderful cliffs and views of the Nant Ceibwr valley. You can explore the splendid cliff tops paths on the Pembrokeshire Coast Path before heading inland to enjoy views of the river as it enters the sea. The area is great for wildlife spotting with coastal birds such as fulmar, shag, cormorant and chough to see on the cliffs. You may also see bottlenose dolphins and Atlantic grey seals in the waters below. The walk can be started at the small roadside parking area on the western side of the bay, just north of the village of Moylgrove. To extend your walk follow the coast path north to visit Cemaes Head or south to the beautiful beaches at Newport .
display_address: Pembrokeshire Coast Path, Nevern, Trewyddel / Moylgrove, Pembrokeshire, Cymru / Wales, SA43 3BU, United Kingdom
